pros: * Good work life balance * Timely Salary * Nice Office Environment
cons: * Might be low opportunity to grow * Some projects have old tech stack

review_title: Position was responsible to coordinate a consortium of 4 organisation to work on urban resilience.
pros: Child centered organisation having world wide reputation as strong supporter for child rights in humanitarian crisis.
cons: Larger organisation, need further effort to collaborate with other functions associated with programme.

review_title: Reviewing Save the Children in Bangladesh
pros:
> Friendly Work Environment
> Various Employee Benefits
> Cooperative Colleagues and boss
> A good place to learn about project management
cons:
> Short duration of project based employments.
> Technological advancement still in progress
> Less usage of modern ERP

pros: Diverse workforce and I got to learn a lot while working in Save the Children. This experience definitely kept me on my toes at all times.
cons: The working hours and lack of getting the instruction got to me after a while. But I was working on a project with an external so it doesn't apply to the corporation itself.

review_title: This is best organization of the world and i feel proud to work with save the children
pros: Children is the next future of the world, so i feel boast to working with the save the children
cons: No flexibility to work with my creativity. Jobs are formative.

pros: Challenging, lots of scope to learn,scope to work with multicultural people, working in such a large org grow managerial capability and experiences.
cons: Recognition level poor, less effort to keep potential employees, Motivating employee is not good
